intro: Adenotrias kotschyi, commonly known as the Kotschyi's adenotrias, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
